trans-unit.source: Configure Software RAID on Linux
trans-unit.target: Configure Software RAID on Linux

trans-unit.source: It's a common scenario to use software RAID on Linux virtual machines in Azure to present multiple attached data disks as a single RAID device.
trans-unit.target: It's a common scenario to use software RAID on Linux virtual machines in Azure to present multiple attached data disks as a single RAID device.

trans-unit.source: Typically this can be used to improve performance and allow for improved throughput compared to using just a single disk.
trans-unit.target: Typically this can be used to improve performance and allow for improved throughput compared to using just a single disk.

trans-unit.source: Attaching data disks
trans-unit.target: Attaching data disks

trans-unit.source: Two or more empty data disks will typically be needed to configure a RAID device.
trans-unit.target: Two or more empty data disks will typically be needed to configure a RAID device.

trans-unit.source: This article will not go into detail on how to attach data disks to a Linux virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: This article will not go into detail on how to attach data disks to a Linux virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Please see the Microsoft Azure article [attach a disk](storage-windows-attach-disk.md#attachempty) for detailed instructions on how to attach an empty data disk to a Linux virtual machine on Azure.
trans-unit.target: Please see the Microsoft Azure article [attach a disk](storage-windows-attach-disk.md#attachempty) for detailed instructions on how to attach an empty data disk to a Linux virtual machine on Azure.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The ExtraSmall VM size does not support more than one data disk attached to the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The ExtraSmall VM size does not support more than one data disk attached to the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Please see [Virtual Machine and Cloud Service Sizes for Microsoft Azure](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn197896.aspx) for detailed information about VM sizes and the number of data disks supported.
trans-unit.target: Please see [Virtual Machine and Cloud Service Sizes for Microsoft Azure](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn197896.aspx) for detailed information about VM sizes and the number of data disks supported.
